TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit CommaDelimitedStringCollection extends System.Collections.Specialized.StringCollection

Docs.summary: Represents a collection of string elements separated by commas. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This class represents a string collection that is serialized as a comma-delimited list of string elements.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the CommaDelimitedStringCollection type.
[!code-vb[System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.configuration.c_10_1.vb)] [!code-cs[System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.configuration.c_10_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Add(string value) cil managed

Docs.summary: Adds a string to the comma-delimited collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method causes the <xref:System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection.IsModified%2A> property to be set to `true`.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void AddRange(string[] range) cil managed

Docs.param: An array of strings to add to the collection.
Docs.summary: Adds all the strings in a string array to the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `range` parameter must be an array rather than a comma-delimited string.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the AddRange method. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection> class overview.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method causes the <xref:System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection.IsModified%2A> property to be set to `true`.

.method public hidebysig instance void Insert(int32 index, string value) cil managed

Docs.param: The index in the collection at which the new element will be added.
The value of the new element to add to the collection.
Docs.summary: Adds a string element to the collection at the specified index.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method causes the <xref:System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection.IsModified%2A> property to be set to `true`.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the Insert method. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection> class overview.
[!code-vb[System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection#9](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/6221c2de-eca1-4c39-beb2-_1.vb)] [!code-cs[System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection#9](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/6221c2de-eca1-4c39-beb2-_1.cs)]

Docs.summary: Gets a value that specifies whether the collection has been modified.
Docs.value: if the has been modified; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The IsModified property is `true` after the <xref:System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection.Add%2A>, <xref:System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection.Clear%2A>, <xref:System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection.Insert%2A>, or <xref:System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection.Remove%2A> method has been called. Also, the IsModified property is `true` after the <xref:System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection.Item%2A> property is used to modify an element of the string collection.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the IsModified property. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection> class overview.
[!code-vb[System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection#7](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.configuration.c_15_1.vb)] [!code-cs[System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection#7](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.configuration.c_15_1.cs)]

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the collection object is read-only.
Docs.value: if the specified string element in the is read-only; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property returns `true` if the collection is marked as read-only. This is useful for protecting the element at run time, as opposed to design time. For more information, see the <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement.IsReadOnly%2A> method on the <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement?displayProperty=fullName> class.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the IsReadOnly property. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection> class overview.
[!code-vb[System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection#8](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.configuration.c_22_1.vb)] [!code-cs[System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection#8](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.configuration.c_22_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: public string this[int index] { get; set; }

Docs.param: The index of the string element in the collection.
Docs.summary: Gets or sets a string element in the collection based on the index.
Docs.value: A string element in the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property allows a string in the collection to be set or retrieved based on its index in the collection. This property also causes the <xref:System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection.IsModified%2A> property to be set to `true`.

Docs.summary: Removes a string element from the collection.

remarks.format:

Docs.summary: Sets the collection object to read-only.

remarks.format: ## Remarks To determine whether the <xref:System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection> collection can be modified, call the <xref:System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection.IsReadOnly%2A> method.
